techmeme.title: Cloudflare Radar: TikTok has nearly bounced back to its original traffic levels after usage fell 85% when the app temporarily shut down on January 19 (Zach Vallese/CNBC)
Israel-based Anchor, a platform for automated invoice management and collection, raised a $20M Series A, and plans to expand in the US and double its workforce (Meir Orbach/CTech)
Kalshi plans to let users buy into its prediction markets directly from brokerages, says it now has 908 active contracts, up from 691 on Election Day (Michael J. de la Merced/New York Times)
A close look at DeepSeek, which is estimated to have access to ~50K Hopper GPUs, a total server capex of ~$1.3B, and a GPU spend of $500M+ over its history (Dylan Patel/SemiAnalysis)
Adobe Chief Strategy Officer Scott Belsky leaves the company to join A24 film studio as a partner; he co-founded Behance, which Adobe acquired for $150M in 2012 (Todd Spangler/Variety)
